title: NSTCG Campaign Strategy Call - Phase 2 Planning
content:
BARRY CADE: Alright everyone, thanks for joining tonight's strategy call. We need to discuss our response to yesterday's council meeting. I heard David Hollister made some interesting comments.

PHILIPPE EDES: Interesting is one way to put it, Barry. He directly violated Purdah restrictions by mentioning me by name and disparaging our campaign. Margaret Thorne stood up to him though.

ALICE CHEN: I'm Alice Chen, I'm new to the group - I run Chen's Hardware on Station Road. The Shore Road closure would devastate our deliveries. I want to help however I can.

BARRY CADE: Welcome Alice! We need all the local business support we can get. James, can you update us on the statistics complaint?

JAMES MORRISON: I've drafted the formal complaint to the UK Statistics Authority. The key points are the mid-survey CAPTCHA implementation on June 26th and the lack of paper alternatives for elderly residents. I'll need your review, Barry, before we submit.

BARRY CADE: Send it to me tonight, I'll review first thing tomorrow. Now, let's talk about the pressure campaign. We need to organize an email campaign targeting Cliff Sutton - he's the weak link in the council.

PHILIPPE EDES: Agreed. Also, I've been thinking - we should reach out to the Purbeck Gazette. Their editor, Michael Harrington, might be sympathetic to our cause. He's no friend of Swanage News.

ALICE CHEN: I can organize the Station Road Business Association. We represent 15 shops and restaurants that would be affected.

JAMES MORRISON: That's brilliant, Alice. Barry, should we create a dedicated task force for business outreach?

BARRY CADE: Absolutely. Alice, I'm putting you in charge of business community outreach. Can you have a list of affected businesses and their concerns by Friday?

ALICE CHEN: Consider it done.

PHILIPPE EDES: We also need to address the Dorset Highways consultation. They're working hand-in-hand with DCF on this.

BARRY CADE: Good point. James, add Dorset Highways to your complaint. They're complicit in this sham consultation.

JAMES MORRISON: Will do. Also, I've discovered something interesting - Engagement HQ is actually a subsidiary of Granicus, a much larger company. This goes deeper than we thought.

BARRY CADE: Document everything. We might need to escalate this beyond local authorities. 

PHILIPPE EDES: Speaking of escalation, I've been invited to speak at the Dorset Democracy Forum next week. It's a regional group that monitors local government transparency.

BARRY CADE: Excellent platform. Make sure to mention the Purdah violation and the survey manipulation.

ALICE CHEN: Should we be documenting all these transgressions somewhere central? We're gathering a lot of evidence.

JAMES MORRISON: I've been keeping a spreadsheet, but we might need something more robust. Maybe a shared database?

BARRY CADE: James, look into setting up a proper evidence management system. We need everything documented and cross-referenced.

PHILIPPE EDES: Before we wrap up, what about the door-to-door canvassing? The election is next week.

BARRY CADE: I need volunteers for the final push. We're focusing on North Swanage, particularly the streets around Newton Road and Redcliffe Road. Can everyone commit to at least two hours this weekend?

ALL: Yes, confirmed.

JAMES MORRISON: One more thing - I've heard rumors that Dorset Council might be reviewing their relationship with DCF after our complaints. My contact at County Hall, Sandra Williams, mentioned it off the record.

BARRY CADE: Interesting. James, can you follow up with Sandra? But carefully - we don't want to compromise her position.

PHILIPPE EDES: This is all very encouraging. We're building real momentum.

BARRY CADE: Indeed. Let's recap assignments: James - finalize the Statistics Authority complaint and research evidence management systems. Alice - organize the business association and get that impact list. Phillippe - prepare for the Democracy Forum. I'll handle the Cliff Sutton email campaign and coordinate canvassing. Any questions?

ALICE CHEN: Just one - should we be worried about retaliation? David Hollister seems quite vindictive.

BARRY CADE: Document everything, stay factual, and always operate in groups when canvassing. We're on the right side of this.

JAMES MORRISON: Agreed. Truth is our best defense.

BARRY CADE: Alright team, let's reconvene Friday evening. Stay strong, stay focused. We're going to win this.

[Call ends]

tasks.name: Review and submit UK Statistics Authority complaint
Organize email campaign targeting Cliff Sutton
Create list of affected businesses and concerns
Prepare presentation for Dorset Democracy Forum
Follow up with Sandra Williams at County Hall

new_entity_creation: Alice Chen - new person with business
Station Road Business Association - new organization
